TopicTitle: Kerbfleet: A Jool Odyssey-CHAPTER 21 pg 28--and the answer to Angelo's question is...

Articles.Content: So, did anyone get the Stay Determined reference? Awe,  it was a good one too.

3 hours ago, Alchemist said:

If male Kerbulans have beards, I wonder what's the quirk with females. Brezhnev-style eyebrows?

From what I remember, the females didn't look much different, but they definitely dressed hotter.... and in my opinion, were much more devious and terrifying then the mirror males...

Anyone here remember Kira's mirror counterpart for DS9???   Just sayin'   

Edited March 24, 2016 by Just Jim
Also, @Kuzzter, Jeb's sword is asymmetrical and it's bugging me.

1 hour ago, SpaceplaneAddict said:

So, did anyone get the Stay Determined reference? Awe,  it was a good one too.

Sorry, I did not. I looked it up later though and it makes sense. I guess i just haven't played that genre of games.

1 hour ago, Just Jim said:

From what I remember, the females didn't look much different, but they definitely dressed hotter....

And not just the females--Kirk too! Believe me if I could have made Val's uniform sleeveless I would have. Also, of course it's just Spock who had the beard, not every male Imperial. But, you know, South Park.

42 minutes ago, RocketSquid said:

Also, @Kuzzter, Jeb's sword is asymmetrical and it's bugging me.

Henceforth complaints about the artwork, demands for new missions, exhortations to post faster, and any and all statements beginning with the words "you should..." will be answered by our customer satisfaction officer, Valentina Kermulan.

You should *whack* ...

Zzzzz

1 hour ago, Kuzzter said:

Henceforth complaints about the artwork, demands for new missions, exhortations to post faster, and any and all statements beginning with the words "you should..." will be answered by our customer satisfaction officer, Valentina Kermulan. 

I wasn't telling you to fix it... It's impressive for powerpoint. I just need to talk about things that bug me so they stop bugging me...

4 minutes ago, RocketSquid said:

I just need to talk about things that bug me so they stop bugging me...

No worries... I guess i have the same problem  

You're right though it is asymmetric... maybe that just makes it a more terrifying weapon. Hm... perhaps the Empire should also use bad kerning on the flag, that'd really mess with their enemies.

19 minutes ago, Kuzzter said:

No worries... I guess i have the same problem  

You're right though it is asymmetric... maybe that just makes it a more terrifying weapon. Hm... perhaps the Empire should also use bad kerning on the flag, that'd really mess with their enemies. 

"Mwaha! Those Kerbulan fools have left a gaping hole in their defenses, and soon Rocomaximus will rule the planet! Wait a second... that flag says "S P QK"! What!? GAHH!!" *crashes ship into flagpole*
Bad kerning? These Kennulans know no shame...

Moar! Pease @Kuzzter please! 

I hope Bill knows how to put together a bloaking device out of extra parts...

My hypothesis? The reason the persistomancers don't know about one another is that each is only able to access and edit his own SAVE's persistence data, and the Kerbals and Kerbulans inhabit different SAVEs. As to how they manage to observe one another, I blame the multiversal glitches that occurred during the crossover. Why wouldn't they leave residue?

'Course this bodes ill for the fate of the Kerbulans if they try to destroy the Kerbals...

I just thought of something.

In Chapter 6, Bob and Nimzo play Cheks. It itself is not a big deal. However, they are in zero G. So why do the pieces float and drift?

Quote

it is asymmetric... maybe that just makes it a more terrifying weapon. Hm... perhaps the Empire should also use bad kerning on the flag, that'd really mess with their enemies. 

Properly designed asymmetry in edged weapons very useful for particular purposes, either in stabbing or slashing.  But that makes the weapon specialized for one of those uses and less effective at others.  I would assume the asymmetry of Jeb's weapons makes it work very well for back-stabbing other Kerbulians.

Edited March 25, 2016 by Geschosskopf

4 hours ago, rlin said:

In Chapter 6, Bob and Nimzo play Cheks. It itself is not a big deal. However, they are in zero G. So why do the pieces float and drift?

It's obvious. Metallic surface of the board, little magnets in the pieces - I have such set.

And there are so many things used in space that are magnetic for the same reason - so you can put them somewhere and they won't drift away across the station.

6 hours ago, Alchemist said:

And there are so many things used in space that are magnetic for the same reason - so you can put them somewhere and they won't drift away across the station.

And let's let that explanation stand for all the stuff in the Planetary Base Systems IVA, which appear to have been rendered for use on the surface, so there are cables on the floor, books on the tables, etc.  

So like I said we can expect a gap of a few days before the next pages. But I can always tease  Here's Intrepid just after Kerbin SOI escape:

So it turns out that we are able to store data in the lab, it's just that every time we do so the dialogue says there wasn't enough space. Looks like a bug, but a benign one. I'm keeping the lab loaded up with data, of course, and transmitting every 20 days or so--you can see that with Bob and Lisa in there, it makes science at quite a prodigious rate. That'll make Mort happy, since we're licensing 100% of it now, to the tune of 2594.58 kerbucks per science point, or about 28,500 per day for as long as I can keep the data buffers filled.

So I have some external shots now, will get the rest plus the "sound stage" IVAs, and the new pages will appear when they appear. In the meantime, a riddle: what masses about 200 tons, is 42,195 meters long, takes a middle-aged guy in good shape about 3 1/2 hours to finish, and will start appearing in its own thread some time after 1.1 is released and certain critical mods are updated?

27 minutes ago, Kuzzter said:

And let's let that explanation stand for all the stuff in the Planetary Base Systems IVA, which appear to have been rendered for use on the surface, so there are cables on the floor, books on the tables, etc.  

So like I said we can expect a gap of a few days before the next pages. But I can always tease  Here's Intrepid just after Kerbin SOI escape:

 

So it turns out that we are able to store data in the lab, it's just that every time we do so the dialogue says there wasn't enough space. Looks like a bug, but a benign one. I'm keeping the lab loaded up with data, of course, and transmitting every 20 days or so--you can see that with Bob and Lisa in there, it makes science at quite a prodigious rate. That'll make Mort happy, since we're licensing 100% of it now, to the tune of 2594.58 kerbucks per science point, or about 28,500 per day for as long as I can keep the data buffers filled.

So I have some external shots now, will get the rest plus the "sound stage" IVAs, and the new pages will appear when they appear. In the meantime, a riddle: what masses about 200 tons, is 42,195 meters long, takes a middle-aged guy in good shape about 3 1/2 hours to finish, and will start appearing in its own thread some time after 1.1 is released and certain critical mods are updated?  

I hate riddles, but I'm guessing something wonderful terrifying. nud nud NUD! NUD NUUUDDDD! A Looj Yessydo. BTW, I saw Squadcast last night and EJ had a 600-part vessel on the stream. 1.1 was humming along at 25 frames per second. And the IVA mode gave you a look inside the cockpit of a stock cargo plane complete with kerbals- no extra stealth kerbals needed to get those interesting shots.

3 minutes ago, Angel-125 said:

I saw Squadcast last night and EJ had a 600-part vessel on the stream. 1.1 was humming along at 25 frames per second. 

Oh my, don't get my hopes up...Intrepid is only about 800, and might get near six once she fires all of her nuclear weapons at Kerbulus puts the scansats in orbit around the Joolian moons and sends in the atmospheric probes.

Yup, looking forward to the new release. Back on topic, can't wait to see what @Kuzzter does next! Will there be another story while the Intrepid makes her way to Jool?
